moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 Bg7 4. e4 d6 5: The starting position for all the games.
moves.9. d5 c6: I decide to lessen White's Pawn center.
moves.10. Rb1 cxd5: After this exchange, White will only have two strong central Pawns and not three, plus his Pawns will be fixed.
moves.11. cxd5 a5: To secure the outpost on QB4 for my Knight.
moves.13. Be3 b6: Adding support. Now I can recapture with the QNP in case of BxN and not give White a passed QP on the recapture.
moves.14. Nb5 Ng4: Looking to rid White of his "good" Bishop. His KB is blocked off by his own central Pawns.
moves.15. Qd2 Nxe3: I initiate an exchange of minors.
moves.16. Qxe3 Ba6: Since my position is somewhat cramped, I look to swap off more pieces.
moves.17. Nbc3 Bxe2: I initate another exchange. The less wood on the board, the less serious my cramped state [aside from the one good Knight] becomes.
moves.18... Rc8: I plant my Rook on the only open file.
moves.19. Rbc1: White plants *his* Rook on the same file to match me.
moves.19... f5: Time to claim a little bit of space on the K side.
moves.20. b3: Countering by slowing any Q side ambitions I might have.
moves.22... Nxe4: ...this tactical shot wins a piece. [23 NxN RxR or 23 RxN BxN.] White resigns at once.
